newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Flughafen Wien 9-mth passenger, freight up.
newsitem.headline: Flughafen Wien 9-mth passenger, freight up.

text.p: Vienna international airport company Flughafen Wien AG on Tuesday reported a 7.6 percent increase in passenger numbers in the first nine months and forecast similar growth for the full year.
In a statement, Flughafen said there were 7.1 million passengers in the nine months to end-September and 2.8 million in the third quarter, up 6.8 percent on third quarter 1995.
It said it expected 9.2 million passengers for the full year, a rise of 7.6 percent.

"This represents healthy growth, especially after 1995's exceptionally strong 10.6 percent increase," Flughafen said, adding that the effects of European cost-cutting had become evident in the second quarter.
It registered the biggest increase in passengers from the Far East. Their numbers jumped 30 percent to over 52,000 in the third quarter following an advertising campaign in the region.
The company said there were 117,826 take-offs and landings in the first nine months, 9.6 percent up on the previous year. Maximum take-off weight rose 11.1 percent.
Freight traffic increased 1.1 percent to 91,965 tonnes. The firm noted that some other West European airports had seen a decline in freight traffic over the same period.
